review_blob: Bottle @ The Trappist.  Incredible balance of hops, yeast, spice, and tartness.

I really like this color.  Crystal clear light orange color.  Aroma of cooked strawberries, acidity, and just a little bit of lambic funk.  Flavor is tart but nowhere near a Cantillon.  Flavors of strawberries, citrus, must.  This is cool, I wouldnt mind some other blenders making strawberry lambics.

12 oz bottle from the brewery courtesy of Tetrik.  Dark copper colored and essentially still.  This has an aroma full of bourbon, sweetness, hops, and alcohol.  I can tell this is going to be intense...  Acidic flavor from the hops as soon as it touches the mouth, leading to sugary sweetness, then to bourbony alcohol, and finishing with an awesome bitterness on the way down the throat.  Extremely long aftertaste and very warming.  Am I drinking beer?  Mouthfeel was surprisingly smooth for something so high gravity.  This was really well done for something so outrageous.  In my opinion, this is quite a bit nicer than DFH 120 min.

Finally am tasting one of my bottles of this.  Beautiful dark brown with some fine bubbles on top.  Aroma of toffee, molasses, vanilla, malted barley, bourbon.  Wow that smells awesome.  This also tastes very awesome: extremely bready, some fruits in the back of the mouth, vanilla.  I agree with 1FastSTi, definitely some tobacco going on here.  Mouthfeel is soo smooth and full, but not cloying despite being really sweet and having a super long aftertaste.  Overall this is a really remarkable beer.  I wish I would have gotten more of this last winter.  I love this brewery!
beer_name: Kuhnhenn Fourth Dementia (4D) Old Ale - Bourbon Barrel

review_blob: 1995 Vintage at Eccentric Cafe.  This was very interesting.  Dark red/brown color with almost no carbonation or head.  Aroma was extremely spicy, almost smelled like a ginger beer, but with some alcohol.  Flavor was sweet malty barleywine as a backbone with lots of spice in the middle and finish, especially ginger.  This had a very sharp and almost bitter finish due to the spicyness, I found this very intriguing.  I tried this next to a 1999 vintage that my buddy was drinking which did not have nearly the same amount of spice.  Overall this was an interesting beer to try once.

Batch 002 Bottle.  Foam gushed from the bottle upon upening, but poured a nice clear copper-brown.  Aroma is sour cherries, apples, wood.  Flavor is absolutely fantastic!  Wine, oak, sour, brettanomyces.  This is really really nice!

82 sampled at Kulminator last week.  Dark cloudy brown head with a nice tan head, nice to see its still carbonated.  Aroma of sour cherries, oak, apple cider, old cellar.  Flavvor was like an old vintage port, sour cherries.  Excellent smooth and full palate.  This is an awesome beer.  I was really surprised by how sour it turned out with age.
beer_name: Eldridge Pope Thomas Hardys Ale (all vintages to 1999)

review_blob: 1981 bottle as Bass Kigs Ale at Kulminator.  Clear Copper color with large bubbles.  Aromas of honey, wet dog, brown sugar, sweet flowers, barley.  Taste is sweet, honey, malty, maybe a tiny bit smokey.  The mouthfeel was smooth, but a bit watery.   have a feeling this was probably past its prime.

Very deep red for a lambic, with fine pinkish bubbles on top.  Evil-looking.  Smells like dried high-quality cherries, sour-aromas, slightly cheese-like.  Taste is sour funk, quality cherries, slight sweetness that is balanced perfectly by the lambic sourness.  Smooth full and round in the mouth.  This is the best Kriek Ive ever had yet!

Bottle at Arancia Blu in Rome.  Had this with some delicious fresh pasta.  Aroma was very fruity and flowery - maybe a bit of honeysuckle, orange blossom.  Flavor was lightly sweet, but also a bit bitter and acidic which made it go great with food.  Also had flavors of black pepper, coriander, and other spices.  Smooth, structured mouthfeel.  Overall pretty decent beer!

Bottle consumed in Rome.  Light brown color with creamy head.  Aroma was very oak and a little bit sour.  The flavor was also very oaky, fruity, and a little bit sour.  Reminded me slightly of a JP beer.  I liked this.
Draft.  Light yellow color with decent carbonation.  Hoppy, musty aroma.  Flavor had a decent amount of bitterness/hoppiness for your average lager.

Bottle at De Spuyt in Amsterdam.  Orangish-Amberish color with a nice head.  Smell was yeasty, fruity, alcoholic.  Flavor was not too complex, but yeast, alcohol, a little bit of fruits.  Overall it was a decent beer.

07 Silver Wax Bottle. Dark black viscous pour with very little carbonation or head.  Awesome aroma of apple pie, pear, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, malt, must.  Taste is chocolate, dark intense coffee, sweet fruits.  Very viscous mouthfeel, this is nice.  I like this 07 batch way better than my 06 bottles last year.
beer_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: Wow.  This was very interesting.  Clear amber pour with fine carbonation.  Smells like a white wine that has tons of lactic acid... very creamy and buttery smell, yet it is still sour and funky.  Smells like sour citrus, grapes, oak, vanilla.  Flavor is also fantastic.  It is pretty funky and sour, but finishes very smooth and creamy (both in flavor and in mouthfeel).  Another great beer by Vinnie!

Ive had this several times but decided to rate it tonight.  Beautiful translucent amber color with no carbonation or head. This stuff has some awesome legs.  aroma is honey, pollen, toffee, madeira, and some earthy funk.  Flavor is definitely oxidized madeira, sweet, honey.  Fantastic mouthfeel that coats your entire mouth cavity.  This stuff is really, really nice.  As a Polish person, Ive had this many times!

Batch 7817.... wow this is the best batch Ive had in a couple of years, I love it.  Dark black appearance with a light tan head.  I get very nostalgic when drinking this beer.  Smells like baking cocoa/dark chocolate, vanilla, coffee, malts, raisins.  Taste is much the same, with an unbelievably smooth, silky, and full mouthfeel.  I will be drinking this beer forever.

22 oz bottle at Monks Cafe in Philadelphia.  Pour was a nice amber color with a light colored head.  Smell is very hoppy and citrusy grapefruit, very nice.  Flavor was much the same of hoppy grapefruit with a lot of a sweet malt backbone to balance out the hops.  Overall this was a pretty balaced DIPA and I liked it.

2004 on draft at Monks.  Very dark reddish color in a trumpet glass with almost no carboation or head.  Very sour and funky aroma.  Flavors of raspberry, barnyard, acid, citrus fruits.  Overall pretty nice, but not the most complex lambic Ive had.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: 22 oz bottle at Monks Cafe in Philadelphia.  Poured into a pint glass, very dark black with a decent light brown head.  Smell was very chocolate, coffee, malt.  Taste is extremely choclatey and roasty, tons of alcoholic heat.  Felt way stronger than 10% ABV, but I enjoyed it.  Pretty nice overall.

Dark black pour with a muddy colored froth on top.  Aroma is coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, barley... very sweet, almost smells like a Starbucks Frappucino or something.  Taste is very sweet and malty up front but with a ridiculously long roasted coffee flavor.  Slight amount of alcohol present in the nose and flavor, just the right amount!  Id love to try this side by side Founders Breakfast Stout, I feel this one would be a little bit more intense.
beer_name: Southern Tier Jah-va Imperial Coffee Stout

review_blob: 2006 bottle out of a Brooklyn glass.  Dark amber clear color with a short lived head.  Smell: sweet fruits, bread, caramelized sugar.  Flavor is sweet, alcohol, fruits, with a spicy/alcoholic mouthfeel.  Id like to try an older bottle of this in the future.

Finally get to try this.  Opaque black pour with a little bit of brown foam.  Aroma is very much chocolate, coffee, malts, oats, dark fruits.  I love the flavor, it is very roasted coffee, quality dark chocolate, slight alcohol burn.   Very rich and full palate.  Im pretty impressed with this.

Clear garnet brown color with minimal head.  Aroma of cloves, banana, bubblegum, iron.  Flavors of bubblegum, oak, alcohol, sugar.  This is really sweet, too sweet even.  Mouthfeel is rather light, but feels cloying because of the sweetness.  Easy to drink but not my favorite.

25.4 oz bottle purchased in Philadelphia.  What a pretty amber red color with just a faint ring of bubbles along the edge.  Aroma of oak, red wine, tannins, funk, red currants, citrus fruits, and spices.  Flavor is much the same, but with a nice acidic/tannic/oaky finish.  Mmm, thats pretty tasty.  The mouthfull is also very smooth and nice, definitely hides the ABV.  This is a special brew.

Another awesome beer that my sister saved for me!!  I had this after a BA Wee Heavy, and couldnt believe that this had so much flavor than the former.  Muddy brown color with a small light brow head.  The aroma is interesting, it smells very metallic and almost like flower pollen.  It also has hints of wildflower honey (maybe thats where the pollen smell is coming from?)  Mouthfeel was so smooth and thick and delicious, quite enjoyable.  Tastes of fruits (clementines or sweet oranges), brandy, malts, alcohol, wood, wow this is complex and strong!  Really nice barleywine.  Would be interesting to try next to a Kuh nhenn brandy barleywine.

I was out visiting my sister in California, and was happy to see that this was on at the brewpub in Santa Rosa.  Had a nice golden color, much like temptation with a white head, light carbonation.  The aroma was awesome, very sour with vinous and oaken notes, also very fruity.  The flavors were really great, like an unripened apricot mixed with oak and white wine.  I really enjoyed this beer a lot, its too bad the bottled batch didnt make it to market.

On cask at Friday the Firkinteeth.  This was the highlight of the day.  I loved this stuff!  Basically imagine sitting at breakfast, having a nice full pancake meal, with maple syrup, sausage, and a little fruit bowl.  Take in that smell and that is this beer.  Flavor was chocolately and maple syruppy, but also smokey.  It was a beautiful cloudy dark brown color.  The mouthfeel was unbelievably smooth.  All I can say is wow!  I wonder if this is as good when its not on cask.

Courtesy of my sister who picked this up at the brewery!  This smells so nice.  Smells like cherries, vanilla, chocolate, caramel, bourbon.  No head or carbonation really, but is a really nice dark reddish brown - very clear.  Tastes strongly of bourbon, vanilla, raisins, wood, malts.  The palate was smooth and drinkable.  Nice!
beer_name: AleSmith Wee Heavy Scotch Ale - Barrel Aged

review_blob: Spring 07 Bottle.  Whats not to like about the appearance?  It looks like a beautiful dark imperial stout.  Aroma is really interesting.  Started with apple cinnamon, vanilla, caramel.  Later some fruityness and some musty notes.  Flavor is quite smooth, I was expecting it to be more bold, especially since its such a fresh bottle; well balanced.  It has lots of rich chocolatey-coffeeish notes, and I can definitely taste the black currants.  The mouthfeel has lots of structure, it is smooth and oily.  Overall this was quite nice.  This is the first year Stone has been distributed in my area, and Im glad to try this!

Growler from Founders.  This beer is awesome!  Very beautiful to look at.  Dark reddish/brownish body with a little bit of lasting foam on top.  Color looks a little bit like a very dark high quality maple syrup.  Aromas of vanilla, oak, bourbon, maybe a little bit of fruit.  Tastes also of bourbon, oak, sweet malts, brown sugar.  This beer starts sweet but finishes very bitter and acidic, which is really nice.  The bourbon is really prominent on this beer, but it works really well with the style.  Love this stuff

12 oz bottle. Aroma on this is very nice.  Hints of oak, nice hops, maple syrup, cream, coffee, vanilla, alcohol, and maybe even a little bit of orange.  The pour is beautiful clear dark copper color, with nice big bubbles.  Flavor has some oak and vanilla, but mostly just very sugary and almost no hop flavor.  Mouthfull is syrupy and a bit sweet, but the alcohol does help cut the sweetness a bit.  Pretty good overall, and definitely not a standard DIPA

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Pretty, hazy orange pour with a head that fades to a creamy froth on top.  Aroma of spices (cloves, pepper), orange and banaa, and bubblegum.  Flavor was much the same with spices, banana, lots of bready yeast, and a litlte bit of a plasticky flavor.  Pretty good.
UPDATED: APR 20, 2007
On tap at Tria Cafe philadelphia.  Nice, dark brown ale color.  Simple(and strong) flavor of spruce.  I didnt taste much molasses in this beer.  Decent beer, but Yards makes better beers than this.
